text: Is there a way to dynamically generate path names to the root url? Currently everything going through a landing page that we don't need. Example: <http://example.com/landing/aaa|example.com/landing/aaa>, <http://example.com/landing/bbb|example.com/landing/bbb>, <http://example.com/landing/ccc|example.com/landing/ccc>. Desired: <http://example.com/aaa|example.com/aaa>, <http://example.com/bbb|example.com/bbb>, <http://example.com/ccc|example.com/ccc>.
so basically what HubSpot has for the blog tool but for LPs? If so, I would also love this so we have an automatic way to create subdirectory paths for our LPs
Which page do you have at `<http://example.com|example.com>`?
Our homepage. I'd love to be able to make a landing page for each of our staff members, but we don't need a staff directory listing all of them.
Can you link a HubDB table to the homepage and just put your dynamic code in there?
Ahhhh I think you're right Matt. I may have just been overthinking it.
So I guess that brings me to my next question lol. Can I use a different template for my dynamic pages?
There's a plan for this functionality however right now you have to keep the dynamic page template in the same file
